reviewText:
Sluggish controlls, camera is too close to action, game doesnt run stable at all, when you change position on minimap it loads textures; I've never seen that in an RTS.

Couldnt find any online games, either noone is playing it or I have to open a port. (What year is this?)

I can't use hotkeys for spells of the hero when he is in a group with normal units, I have to put the hero in his own group which doesn't really work because the group system is bugged, sometimes I can select groups, sometimes not.

It's pretty hard to disgintish units in battle because it gets cluttered up and they just randomly swing around.

The missions I played were so godawfully boring, having to defend from enemy troops which are no threat at all for 15 minutes, couldve gone afk at that point and it wouldn't have made a difference.

All in all this game feels like it should've come out 2001.
voteText: 182 of 203 people (90%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
I thought a game that had initial price of 23.99 would be somewhat polished so I jumped on the sale. I got my buddy to get a free version of the game also. We thought we are going to have a good time. Oh were we wrong. The journey was a very painfull one and full of sorrows. It started with us having no freaking clue wtf was going on during the tutorial. The so called campaign coop tutorial consisted of putting us on the opposite parts of the map and making us beat the ♥♥♥♥ out of each other.
That was fine whatever, eventhough we desynced multiple times. During the second level the desync issue became even worse. We were able to get a couple source nodes before the enemies attacked. Oh the AI pathing was horrendous, I barely managed to get back to my base because AI kept getting stuck inside trees and taking the stupidest routes possible. Well I got home and defended the first wave of the enemies. Then my game crashed to desktop.
My friend kept going forward while my hero stood there without any control at all. I was unable to rejoin the game because it said the current lobby had 5/4 people. After another failed attempt to join it said the lobby was at 6/4. I kept saying wtf is going on. When I was finally able to join the lobby my friend has failed the mission because he was unable to control my hero. Yea this was the best and the worst experience I have had with an indie game. We have played a game called Love by Eskil Steenberg and that says a lot. So overall this was a giant waste of time, bandwidth and harddrive space. Save yourself and fly you fools.

My friend also has this to say. Your game sucks. (period) All of the default hotkeys are completely wrong. There's a game called dota 2. You should play that for a little bit to see how to make control interfaces and hotkeys..""
voteText: 92 of 106 people (87%) found this review helpful 4 people found this review funny

reviewText:
An attempt to copy the Warcraft 3 rts style gone horribly wrong.

-Bad sounds,
-bad graphics/animations
-lack of much needed voice acting for cutscenes
-the unit voice acting is horrible
- Multiplayer is dead.
-You can't save in the middle of missions.
-Unit design has no overall theme (2nd lvl had me commanding amazoness warriors agianst an onslaught of robotic crystalline head crab aliens)
-Levels take far too long to load on my SSD.
-Horrible optimization, runs like crap
-Boring gameplay/missions (Like I was given 4 minutes to prepare a defence when it takes like 30 seconds to prepare everything = 3:30 of A L T T A B B O Y S)
-Nonsensical story

+Steam trading cards

Avoid like the plague even if you have a plague fetish. Not worth even as part of a bundle because time is actually important (damn you civ)

So in conclusion It's like skyrim with cancer"- ign 11/10"

reviewText:
Edit: Some updated thoughts-

Ok, after this game has received many more updates since my first review, I figured I'd give it another shot. Tried a campaign mission, the one where the ice beasts attack. Start fighting them, then boom. Crash to desktop. No 'this program has encountered an error' dialog, no nothing. Alright, so I tried it again. Loaded back into it, played for a bit, and my avatar got taken out. Reload. Playing along, then it crashed to desktop again. And again, no dialog, just no more game. I'll try again if this game receives more updates, but I still can't recommend this. Which is unfortunate, because I want to like the game.

Original review follows:

Cannot really recommend this game. Graphics are servicable, but sound and music fall flat. Gameplay is slow and boring. Plays like the Warhammer games, in that you get resource nodes, instead of chopping down trees, mining, etc. It worked well in those games, but not here. Just a very slow trudge through the map, trying to get to the victory screen. Unless things change a lot over the course of this game, just stay away.

reviewText:
1.1.8 Steam version

Can't really recommend this game in its current state. - potential spoiled by instability.

Clunky UI, fast pace, animations and sound affects can all be forgiven but the general state of the game engine leaves one feling frustrated and annoyed more times than not.

Frequent crash to desktop including but not limited too campaign scripted triggers and avatar/hero death.

Graphics are okay and fully 3d with map rotation. Base building is present with modular assets added to the main building forcing one to choose wisely according to situation and playstyle. Selection of character types for main hero but they all have the same generic army so its only the skill package that varies limiting replayability on the campaign.

Skirmish maps allow team/ffa setups and introduce another playable faction. (Always crashed... longest match lasted 30-40minutes before crashing)

If they can fix the stability issues then this game may be worth investigating properly but It's difficult to gain any real game time when most skirmish / campaign games crash before completion and have to be started from scratch.

edit: 1 year after 1st trying - fresh install of operatring system,new bios,new main drivers, new secondary drivers same old instability. - Game ships with old physx dependencies, 2008 vcredist and directx june2010.

reviewText:
DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review, if you want a full review, then please read better reviews then mine
PLEASE NOTE: If I (the reviewer) have played a game that has less than 1 hour of gameplay and is not recommended, means that I did not enjoy or it did not live up to my expectations! Think twice before rating or giving out a comment...
This game is not finished! There I said it, this game is not finished and it is classed as a finished game, really!?! Where are the sound effects you forgot to place in, where is the rest of the music you forgot to put in, where is the story campaign you forgot to place in, this game is not finished!

Let's start with the sound effects, the BASIC necessity for a game, and this game only offers a few sound effects, no sound effects from when you cast a spell or attack a creature etc... No sound effects when you complete a checkpoint, nothing, no ambient sound effects, no walking sound effects, nothing, pure silence, very boring

Music, the music just repeats itself over and over and over, non-stop, the developers probably didn't even have a clue on which type of music they should feature in the game

Voiceovers, the only voice I hear in this game is your main character, who keeps on saying, I am coming"
recommended: etc... over and over and over again
hoursPlayed: hardly any of the other characters (in the tutorial) have voiceovers
voteText: now I can understand for an RPG game that some voiceovers would not be possible
helpfulPercent: but for a game that only offers a tutorial where the rest is Co-Op and Multiplayer!?!\n\nStory campaign
column17: just a tutorial then after you finish that (which is about 15 minutes)
column18: then it throws you back to the Main Menu and your stuck on what you have to do next
column20: although in the Main Menu it does say Campaign
column21: which is just you playing the Multiplayer/Co-Op features with just AI
column23: no one plays this game so I cannot play Multiplayer/Co-Op and I am not bothered to play with AI\n\nNOT RECOMMENDED :(  If you want a good RPG either play Avencast or Enclave (although they are not recommended in my reviews
column24: I still would recommend playing those than this unfinished game)"

reviewText:
My experience with the game:

- Launch game, click setting... goes to desktop.
- Start tutotial... goes to desktop.
- Tutotial guide stop working, figure it out on your own.
- Found a training area... while the guy was slowly telling me what to do, my fighters killed everything.
- Tried campaign... stab-stab, dead... stab-stab, dead...

So basically, you capture and hold strategiclocations" that give you all resource types and then you spam soldiers against the other guy that spams soldiers.

The main menu failed on me.
The tutorial failed on me.
The campaign intro bored me and the game just feels bad.

The game was also tanking my gamer-PC seriously overheating it.

I can't recommend this."

reviewText:
I am very mixed on giving the big NO as recomendation but unfortunatly this is what it gets..

The Story is kinda interesting with avatars and units and that leveling avatar helps units get better (if I got that right)
BUT it is also crash 9000.
Any crash will set you back to start of the stage with can be very frustrating if you crash at the end of a stage.
Lack of proper pause (atleast for me the units went on in background even tho i went to menu)

I got this game for free and once I used up my card drops it got uninstalled due to being frustrating with crashes.

+ Grafics
+ Story
+ Audio

- Crashes
- Lack of Proper Save
- Lack of Proper Pause function
- Boring Gameplay Elements (Defend for x ammount of minutes)

Maybe with future updates it will become better? But since its been out since 2013 I doubt it..
Save yourself some money and  DON*T BUY IT!

Review Written based upon Gameplay - January 2016

reviewText:
I only played through tutorial and the first mission, but I can say that the game has graphics and gameplay that makes it look like its from 2001. The camera is fine, graphics are decent but I find the combat and pace of the game to be slow, dull, boring and clunky overall. I don't think I want to continue playing further. It seems you can also mostly ignore the enemy, get a few resource spots and build up an army of max population and then avoid fighting the enemy by only rushing objectives, because even if your base gets under attack, you can use extra resources to defend it or maybe even completely ignore it.

Also, troops get stuck in trees and you spend a short while trying to get them out of them

It's just not my type of a game.

reviewText: Frozen Hearth is similar to Baldur's Gate and Age of Empires mixed together. It doesn't offer the versatility of either game, but instead is a territorial defense strategy game, where you claim resource points, create units and take over enemy avatar territory. The game can be played in single player campaign mode, as a skirmish with up to 3 CPU Avatars, in multiplayer and co-op mode, and with varying degree's of difficulty to give yourself a challenge. The game does not offer achievements in Steam, for all the achievement hounds out there, but is still a neat little game.

reviewText:
It's a disaster.

Random crashes during and after completing missions. There is no checkpoint system, mind you, so if crash happens you have to do whole mission again. But not only crashes are bringing frustration. Game has clunky interface, gameplay is poorly executed. There is no sound for many actions, engine is really badly optimized so even on machine that can run it on high settings, you will see the things like slowdowns due to grass drawing and what not.

There is so much bad about it. I did give it fair chance but crashes just demotivated me to keep doing same missions over and over again. And no, crashes are not my fault - game fails to import some assets during gameplay.  To be honest, even if crashes didn't happen, I doubt that I would be happy with overal experience.

reviewText: My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through. I agreed. At 28
date: I have never touched a cigarette. I must say
recommended: I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it
hoursPlayed: because this game gave me cancer anyway."

reviewText: Honestly I am actually enjoying Frozen Hearth, yea sure it may have its bugs, but is there a reason people cannot submit them instead of putting the game down? So far I am enjoying what it has to offer, and yes with various improvements it could be golden. Then again I am not the type of gamer who cares too much whether or not a game has a ton of bugs or not. I have not personally came across any as of yet, nor anything that I would deem this game unplayable.\n\nIt really brings me back to how much fun I used to have playing Age of Empires: Rise of Rome on MSN Zone, and playing it with a friend is a good experience. I am looking forward to seeing what more Frozen Hearth has to offer, as again I am enjoying it so far!

reviewText: Honestly I am actually enjoying Frozen Hearth, yea sure it may have its bugs, but is there a reason people cannot submit them instead of putting the game down? So far I am enjoying what it has to offer, and yes with various improvements it could be golden. Then again I am not the type of gamer who cares too much whether or not a game has a ton of bugs or not. I have not personally came across any as of yet, nor anything that I would deem this game unplayable.\n\nIt really brings me back to how much fun I used to have playing Age of Empires: Rise of Rome on MSN Zone, and playing it with a friend is a good experience. I am looking forward to seeing what more Frozen Hearth has to offer, as again I am enjoying it so far!

reviewText: Frozen Hearth is the Dark Souls of the RTS genre. Incredidably challenging, at times infuriating, but rewarding to the persistent multi-tasking player. It's a shame there wasn't a bit more spit and polish before final release, because when Frozen Hearth isn't distracting you with oddities or omissions, it's actually a rewarding experience.

reviewText: I really liked playing this for some odd reason, its not flawless at ALL, but its not really bad either.  I got this game and after reading a few of the reviews, thought it would be total ♥♥♥....  But I was wrong to assume that.  I played the game, and while it did crash once, it made me feel like I was playing Star Wars Empire at War.   Now am I saying that its as good as that game?  No, but I haven't played a game like this in such a long time that I ended up having a great time.  This game is for those like me who don't play a lot of RTS games, or its there first time ever playing an RTS.  I DO NOT RECCOMEND THIS GAME FOR THOSE WHO WANT AN INDEPTH EXPERIENCE THOUGH.

reviewText:
I loved the feature that when your avatar dies, the game exits out and rage quits for you. The clicking got to me, and before I knew it I had over 2k hours in this game after purchasing it in 2 days and had all the badges and the entire thing completed. I certainly loved the ending where you were just playing a game that crashed multiple times over and over and gave you unlimited chances to play.

If you can't run this, formatting your PC usually works. That's what I did, and it helped me out of ton! Now I can play crash simulator 2015 for another 5k hours in a week! Thanks Obama!


11/10 loved game crash simulator 2015, would fap again.



Just kidding, this game is s♥♥t.

reviewText: This game is unplayable beyond a certain level, and the developers have dropped off the face of the earth. To not acknowledge a fatal flaw and have the decency to address purchasers of the game, I do NOT recommend the game (though it sadly had potential); nor would I recommend any purchase of games from Epiphany Games. In fact, I would recommend a boycott of said games based on principle. Steam should make some effort to hold these shady practitioners accountable for their actions (or inactions), and remove the game from the Steam Store altogether.

reviewText: Frozen Hearth is an overambitious RTS game, with several good ideas such as specialization of your army, and focus on battles instead of base management.
